main event: Multiple reports of an unidentified aerial object sighted over New Orleans, Louisiana in April 1950.
interesting points: The object was described as dark red or orange and completely silent., Observations were made from different locations over a span of several days and involved multiple witnesses., The object appeared to be approximately three feet in diameter and was observed at around 300 feet altitude., Witnesses reported the object moving from northwest to southwest before disappearing., One witness claimed there were disturbances around their automobile while the object was in the sky.
witness description: Civilian observers, including Mr. James Creighton and Mrs. XXX, who reported similar sightings.
